reasons like seasons, they constantly change

After lurking around eljay and its various communities for awhile, i have at long last decided to update.

school was a bore.
I wish there was GP- Mr whitby's snarky/witty/sarcastic comments never fail to perk me up.
Ahu had a mixed doubles match after AEP, so Jianhao and i turned up to cheer him and lauren on.
We ( jianhao xiaoyun lauren and i) decided to play around abit in the free courts and ended up in a 3 on 2 situation. was hilarious when we hit a high one to Jianhao and he gave his racket this powerful swing intended to smash the shuttlecock,  but the racket didnt have any contact with any part of the shuttlecock in the end and ended up landing neatly on the floor, and then Jianhao turned to us with this shocked look, still in mid-smash stance. CLASSIC.
that happened quite a number of times, by the way, until ahu decided to keep on hitting high balls to him for entertainment value. hur hur
 Played 2 on 1 (jianhao and i against ahu) afterward, got thrashed since that moron decided to keep smashing. He actually smashed the shuttlecock straight into jianhao's gut twice and once into mine. (apologized, but with the lame excuse of "but i told you to move away!". in his defence, he DID say that, but between the time he hit the smash and the time when it hit me, there was no bloody time to move -.-)
 I have decided to cut off his welfare benefits (im welfare head, hahaha) and jianhao (pres)is gonna kick him out of art club for that. >:D mohohoh what blatant abuse of authority. we're bullying the meek librarian.

missing out on touchrug camp over the weekend, damn.

AEP combined schools workshop at nyjc on saturday. tape art does sound intriguing.

back to doing va.

:D <3333333333333333333333333333333333333333333333333333333333333
need i say more?


if only all the Korean students visiting our school looked like him.

LONDON-PARIS WITH THE AEPIANS!
it was worth the jetlag, and missing out on precious study time for cts, which reminds me, i only have FOUR DAYS to mug.

joy.

NJAEP (:

after 5 days of NTU hostel,

PRE-U SEM OWNED! SG22 <333
all those memories- the food, the late nights and early mornings, the talks, filming, crapping, and best of all, the company.

love you guys TONS!
























SG OUTING TMR! :D

training ended later, much more than the norm.
it was good! albeit terribly, utterly tiring. coach commented that we improved :)

by the time i washed up and took a shower, it was already dark.
thankfully, the OG people were at the grandstand and ordered pizza in.
mmm, cheesy, fat-ridden goodness.

it was off to island creamery after that! it was already 10++ and we were worried that it would close on us, but there were hoards of people there. got the icecream, then sat around in serene near the staircase to eat/gossip/do stupid things. i love times like these. it makes life that much saner. <3





money in hand > evil vania



i love taking candid shots >:D






brandied cherry & cookiesncream



radiating glee.



lack of seats. hahaa
ah peeeeekk!

Ive been busy. 

Went back to ij today to collect my olvl cert! It was so nostalgic, and made me miss IJ, rodents, 4/3 and mr teh all over again. 
I visited ms low and ms ho at the studio :D god i miss that place! As usual, they were rather stressed outand looked as if they'd want to be anywhere else. Dont we all love AEP. 
And, i found out from them that it was marking day =.= no wonder the entire place was so deserted! That killed my plans to hop upstairs to visit mrs fam and mr teh, meh. 

rewinding a bit, half-day was not such a half-day after all. AEP sova lessons right after formal dismissal, which dragged on. what's more, we have another essay to add to the pile of uncompleted assignments. Just  as we happily handed our goya essay up today, reveling in the feeling of a lifted burden only to have another one crash down on our weary shoulders almost immediately after. 

missed training again, blasted muscle pull.

q_uidproquo's LJ stalker is uni_t!
uni_t is stalking you because your LiveJournal is just SO damned interesting. she is so mentally deranged!
"http://www.go-quiz.com/stalker/stalker.php"


ha ha ha!




------------

finally got my spikes today, after a million years of procrastinating.
queensway with vania and shenchen.- i swear, shenchen youre SUCH an ahmaa! hahahaha.
ambled to IKEA after that, auntie bags and fbts in hand, under the hot hot scorching sun. It didnt help that we were in full grey, our supposed "waterproof" uniform- they forgot to mention that it soaks up heatwaves like a bloody sponge.
Had our cheapo $1 hotdogs. mmmm.

HAPPY 18TH UNI TANDIONONONONONONO

<333333

sorry i couldnt make it for sentosa! but its ohkay, i was there in spirit.

campaigning day!
it was not as bad as i thought it would be: reason being, we got through it as GROUP2, our speech and debate ending at 940. hence, we just bummed around the canteen extension after that.
i think i remained fairly inconspicuous. 
let's hope that my senior's observation that its more difficult to get OUT of council than into it doesn't apply to this year's batch.

i have a million function questions to attempt.
and training tmr at 715am. mraaaah.

campaigning has been a downright chore. it should be spelt as camPAINing instead. 
anyhow, i had a very fruitful double free period today- one spent on chem bonding and the other catching up on much needed sleep. 50 minutes of slumbering bliss. 
sova was good, we had a few good laughs at the sorry lives of certain artists. 
funny how all of them seem to die at very young ages. 15th century artist-plague. 

yawn! 
pft and starbucks tmr. :)

i have
1 sequences and summation math assignment
1 math induction tutorial
1 chemical bonding II tutorial
1 chemical bonding III tutorial
1 AEP portfolio
1 PW PI


so wtf am i doing online!? -.-

im tired.

for the past three or so days, i have been leaving school at bout 730pm, coming home and sleeping after 1130 due to the fact that i cant complete my work, and my hair's still damp. 
not that ive completed much work. 

leadership symposium has been wonderful :)
apart from the fact that we're legally excused from lessons throughout the day, we get to sit in dialogues with ex-njcians who are now serving in the public sector.It really has been enlightening and a real eye-opener, especially for people like myself who dont dabble in politics or even current affairs, preferring to wallow in our own little bubble, insouciant and ignorant of whats happening in the world. There's always something special about sharing your own immature 17-year-old  views about a world you know so little of, with a peer, a senior, who is mature enough to provide insightful comments yet youthful enough for you to relate to them. Little anecdotes  of their school days in NJ, comments on how the uniform hasnt changed, opinions on governance and politics in singapore- it has been, so far, the most enriching two days. 

of course, the highlight of the programme is the FOOD, in which, i am glad to announce, we have in abundance. today alone, we had two tea breaks, and one lunch hour where all the food was catered, and no repeat dishes spanning over all three meals! divine. 
although i must admit, the mee goreng leaves much to be desired. hurr.

symposium ended at around 530, 6 today. headed for aep after that to continue the easel sketch. as it turned out, i ended up doing more crapping, friendstering, and pikachu volleyballing with them than anything else.
typical. :D

val and i called up ms low today, and we had a little chat with her over the loudspeaker, although she was having dinner at that time. i miss meeessss looooowww! and all her pet fish. 

OG outing soon (:

so,
my tuesdays run late, but have multiple free periods slotted in between the lessons. 
my timetable went something like this: chem, free period, break, math lecture, free period, PW, lunch, PW, free period, PE. 
2/3 of them were rather productive, i might proudly add. dont you just love the feeling of completing all of those damned tutorial questions? 

we got mr ng as a chem tutor. godsaveus. he was ohkay as a CT and all, but i doubt i'll enjoy having him as a tutor. he s just such a rigid, stuffy old man! to quote, "if you dont do your tutorials twice, i ll be calling up your parents." DUDE, who even says that to JC students any more?? its the freaking 21st century. 

anyhow, math lecture was... interesting. especially if the lecturer is also your math tutor, and happens to be very familiar with your name. i swear that laser was cursed. it was LONGHAO! -points. i feel so misunderstood. 

hahahaha. 


PE was total trash, apart from CELLE, my sole friend in the IP-dominated OG1 PE class i have been thrown into, and the fact that for once, i felt good after height and weight taking. :D 

met some of olds13 in the canteen after that, and went down with honghu, sndrew and daph to play a little bball. poor honghu actually ended school promptly at 2pm, but was still hanging around even at 4pm. due to a twist of events. heh. 

(conversation is abridged and para-phrased.)

me: honghuuuuu you end school at 2 right?
him: yeah. :D you have pe!
me: yeah, at 250. free period before that, after PW. 
him: -points and laughs mockingly
me: since youre so free, you can keep me company during my free period. -GRINS

and so, he ended up staying. aww. 

(later on)

me: PE!
him: ohkay, maybe i ll just go home
grace. honghuuu! my training only starts at 430. -GRINS

AND SO, poor ahu stayed with both of us. after which we all headed down the courts. it was the reds, me and daph, against the greys, ahu and andrew. it was SUCH an amusing game! i think i worked my abs from all the laughing more than arms from shooting and dribbling. reason being, daph and andrew SCREAMING/ SHOUTING all throughout the game. it was SUPER HILARIOUS! 

met longhao, jeffrey, shoo and ailin soon after, and played a spot of street soccer at our very own nj street soccer court! although we had a loser football (those plastic, brightly dyed ones) it was another very amusing game. 
old07s13!<333

headed home, after hovering around the track, and cheering "GO GRACCCEEE!" at grace who was doing track warmups, everytime she jogged passed the spot we were standing at. funnyy! i think she was embarrassed. and pretended that we were mere spirits on the track, neither seen nor heard. haha. 

HOME.

im lazy to type.
school has been wonderful, with all my current favourite people (:
TABBY. isnt he the most adorable thing?? lucky ailin.

holland V, dinner with OLD07S13










dont we all LOVE truth or dare. :D  ahu was doing pushups over andrew, if you cant tell from the very misleading picture. hahaha.

s13 got split up.
It hadn't really sunk in, until civics, and i found myself in unfamiliar surroundings. you never really appreciate those times, until youre without it. I miss civics with all you wacky people in 07s13. meh!

mr low just sent me a msg, telling me to see the HOD of math tmr, about transferring back to s13, and that there are only 3 vacancies.
aww, mr low is such a nice ct! (:
i really really want to be a part of s13 again, but i dont see how me transferring back will make any difference, because we re all split up. sad.
its not as if me appealing back in will bring back the old 07s13.

and so we're back as 07S13,  plus some lost souls and minus two mehmehs, who will ultimately be transferred back anyway. :)

I LOVE 07S13.

dance party was awesome - Never knew my classmates could shake like that.
 it was hilarious!
i repeated all three mass dance routines over and over again, grabbing random partners everytime they blasted public affair, high school musical, or summer love.
danced with shalom, shalom's friend and lauren the bulk of the time, stole some other OG's pizza and lemon tea, danced somemore with my favourite NJ people (meh!), did OG cheers, etc etc.
i had a BLAST.




<3

YEOW JIANHAO, YOU SUCK!
YOU OWE ALL OF US A LIFETIME SUPPLY OF POCKY.

im sorry i wasnt able to make it today :(

TGIF!- not really.
had math and chem tutorials in the morning, then stoned my way through 50 minutes of lum chee fai's math lecture on GC. He was basically rambling to himself and fiddling with his own GC, while we were left to our own devices. All i did was amuse myself with the GC'S fabulous alpha-function, in which you can type out every single alphabet on the calculator screen:D,  something we were sorely deprived off with the sharps (and resorted to churning out some letters from numbers and weird equations).
HENCE, the entire time i was attempting to follow the step-by-step instructions in the lecture notes (i kept getting ERROR) and typing "SZE SAYS HI!" "AHUUUU" " SHENCHEN" "HONG HU? BUYING GLUE" and disturbing hong hu, who was trying to sleep.

Consistency With Power And Aggression-We make mistakes,we reflect on them, but we can never be perfect says:
i just ate MMM :D


GO qinrui! thats the way! its KFC for you next. hurr


anyhow, i skipped econs lecture with shenchen and trooped down to the canteen, justifying our actions by complaining about mrs koh's inherent lack of teaching skills. Met grace, lauren and other random people on the way down, and found out that they just skipped math lecture!
i guess theres no running away from my part-time student status.
sat ourselves down in the canteen extension, when we spotted longhao (who is the easiest to spot- standing at 2.02 and everything...) , and he came to sit with us. turns out that he was skipping chem tutorial!
gee, talk about NJ being a mugger school.
we're only mugging because we skip lessons. hurr.


AEP was good! we spent our time painting the huge boards, and basically preparing for the mini-exhibition.
AEP= pocky.

shopping and coffee today with the aunties+ one ah pek
"aunties" here being the collective term in place of  "girls" or "ladies", because we re such yakkers :D
( oh, and charlie being an ah pek because... he simply IS one. exuding that total ahpek-ness and all. )

had a fantastic time strolling from shop to shop, purchasing more earstuds, tops, accessories, and an even better time with all of them at starbucks. We have such an affinity with that place- must be because it was formally CCE, our favourite haunt way back then in sec 2. Being there with and talking to them made me realise how must i miss having them in the same school compound. :(  (with the exception of charlie, obviously. he s just... extra. i kid.)

anyhow, school tomorrow. time to dig up my old ss notes for econs tutorial. irkk.

monday. it was a rather draggy day, which ended terribly late because i kept dilly-dallying. Lessons were per normal, with mrs koh tutoring a class of unresponsive people, last-minute econs presentations and sleep-inducing lectures. Blame LT5 for being that conducive for an afternoon siesta. We had our most rigorous PE session today, which consisted of running and more running; one round for warm up, then 2.4 time trial. Mr tong dismissed us straight after 2.4 though, he s nice that way. I guess he was feeling merciful and decided not to torture us any further. Trooped off to the student lounge with honghu and jianhao to purchase council application forms, and hovered around afterward, gossiping with adeline, our dear OGL, after they both left. It was a good chat :)

I went for the funeral wake at st joseph's at night.
We arrived just in time for the service. The atmosphere was heavy, with a melancholic chorus mourning hymns. throughout the service, we stood respectfully at the back, but could hear his mother wailing from inside the room. At the end of the service, we joined the queue to pay our last respects, and to offer up condolences to mrs low. Words failed me when uni and i gave her a tight hug, because there's just nothing you can say to someone that would help ease that pain, that loss; nothing helps, and all you can do is pray for them, hoping for the best. Mrs Low was so strong, smiling while thanking everyone for coming and offering support, although her pale face and lack of verve betrayed signs of heavy grieving.
I felt terrible that the wake hosted several mini reunions, with groups of students huddled together and exchanging amusing little anecdotes about JC life. It was good that our positive energy lightened the mood, though.



tuesday. one word: slack. With only two tutorials and a math lecture, tuesdays would be the prime choice as the perfect day to pon school. However, because i actually enjoy math tutorials with my math tutor and classmates, I still haul myself to school early every tuesday morning for school. today was no exception.
Lessons for me ended at 1140 (HOHO!) much to the chagrin of other S13 people, who still have lessons at 250. went for a jog with jianhao qinrui and honghu, first to qinrui's place ,with val, to drop off our valuables. He has the most adorable dog, cookie (!!!!), but cruelly fences her into this small area in the front yard, with some other dog who kept barking. poor cookie :(
Then, we proceeded to cluney park and did a round, ran back to qinrui's and then to corro plaza to buy lunch. headed back to school by bus after that, since they had lessons at 250. Sat around with my DEAREST classmates at the grandstand, now our fave haunt on tuesday afternoons since IPW only commences in term2, and had my lunch.
Left for home when they headed for lessons.
hur hur.
i love tuesdays.

FAILURE #1: laughing too much



FAILURE #2: qinrui doesnt know that its his turn to wave!



FAILURE #3: forgot to switch to self-time instead of 9-shot, hence the striking resemblence to retardly, over-zealous bouncing bunnies.


LOVE!

we shall call this.... transgender day?


 
qinrui + hong hu! 





lauren + i :)




aww, they look so delighted :D

this is what you get when you put a bunch of crazed 07s13s, a huge black marker and 4 free 50-minute periods together: 

- joined letter writing for andrew's mortal: each of us took turns to describe andrew, each in a different pen and obviously different handwriting. we ended up writing a load of crap and self-deprecating stuff (all in good fun) so he ended up sounding like someone with split personalities and a real low self-esteem. hurrr

- used my uber large black permanent marker to graffitize our arms. long hao ended up with a huge ahbeng "long" character on his left forearm, and i did the word "BOSS" for him on the other forearm. jean suggested extending it to "BOSSini". ahahaha. long hao argued that it should be "hugoBOSS" instead.

- doing a huge "YU YUAN" for fishball, in similar ahbeng fashion as long hao's. they did the gangster walk down the canteen and cracked jokes about extorting protection money/ getting free food/ etc etc. 
fishball's joke about ms sharon phua noticing his tatoo: "you think you look damn cool with that tatoo?? you ll look even cooler with one arm. (insert anguished cry)" 

- loads of snacking. 

-loads of gossiping and lame jokes. which crack us up regardless of the high degree of lameness.
comparative and absolute advantage should never have been discovered.

i have a sudden urge to watch da chang jing.

anyhow,i had a rather good workout during pe today. thanks to certain annoying canoeists who pushed jianhao to run faster and faster while i lagged behind with hong hu. -.- and we were supposed to be pacing against each other! humph.
I am so out of shape and my stamina has dropped so tremendously that its not funny.

had a bit of mindless fun playing games with our senior class during house bonding (CAAL period), although the guys there are so languid and un-participative.

walked over to HCI with daphne after school, and met eve, francoise and nasha at the HCI bus stop. eve smuggled us in and we walked through the vast expanse of hwa chong till we reached the canteen, occupied a vacant table and talked about our respective schools. AC ib sounds as if the entire 94% male population is made up of MCPs, something about being brought up as alpha males. hur. Eve told us some gossip about certain people in her school, which perked us all up a bit. ah, the wonders of juicy gossip.

walked all the way back to the bus stop, and crossed over to NJ with nasha and francoise. they were stopped by the guard since nasha didnt have the NJ pin, but we managed to churn out some fabricated story of her being an NJcian who lost her badge and was going back in to buy one, and by being really polite to the uncle, he let us through with a smile.
>:D


got some bubbletea and walked with them around the school. left soon after by the main gate and took 74 with them back, although they stop at macritchie to transfer buses.
gosh, i really do miss my 4/3 classmates. =/
it was great seeing the two of them again and having our little session after so many weeks of being virtually out of touch.

cant wait for jogging at macritchie with you guys :)




mucho love <33

take me by the hand, take me somewhere new.



Monday marks the start of a fresh week of school. 
i completed the OG15 tee design yesterday- hopefully there wont be any violent objections and we can proceed with printing soon. soon meaning before the o level results are published, and (HOPEFULLY NOT) people leave. I already know a few who are adamant on crossing over to the dark side (HCI. hahaha no offence eve, its just a joke), and others like me who are stepping on thin ice here, unsure of whether we can continue staying in NJ. 

PE was rather fun today. it was good to work out, albeit not very strenuously, after not doing any proper exercise since after prelims. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


the news came so suddenly, its still so surreal.
i just hope everything will work out fine.

NJ so far:


- empty-ish time tables, with gaps in between, especially with 4 free 50-min periods on fridays before art at 250
-math lectures with baffling mixes of sin cos and tan
-math tutorials with mr low, who goes " oh my god! there are 2cos2xs!" etc etc while solving trigo problems
-mrs koh, the boring econs tutor
-boring econs lectures, which totally kill off any interest value in the subject.
-GP with ms koh's striking resemblance to ms ratulangi,  and her cute apples-to-apples card game
-AEP frame composition line drawing practice with mr lee, our sarcastic teacher
-rather interesting intro lesson to SOVA aith ms lu
-switching uniforms with grace and being a crescent girl for a day, confusing my poor civics tutor
-jumping pictures with flappy pockets
-canteen food
- DISNEY NIGHT, our class turning up in full force with identical ODYSSEY tees, to support our dearest IP friends from OG15
-sitting at the back with the class, cracking jokes and making snarky comments about the performances with qinrui and jeffrey
-taking class photos, with some VERY significant arrangements, and doing our OG15 cheer for no apparent reason.
-late night macs and island creamery at serene centre after disney night, with OG15.
horlicks-caramel ice cream mix<33

i was just watching american idol auditions. i watched the first telecast, and then watched it again during primetime. it has GOT to be the absolute most entertaining show!
i was so tickled by the people who queue so darn long and then screw up the auditions majorly, and then shoot their mouths off cussing at the judges when they arent even aware of how dreadful they honestly sound. these people are such sad cases. then again, its because of their lack of talent and utterly large egos that we have such good reality programmes. hoho.

i should really be getting down to my math tutorial questions right now, but im totally hooked onto doing aep homework, in which which i have actually completed the quota but want to draw more. oh well. theres always tmr morning. 

and i just mailed over the completed GP class list to ms koh.
 waaaaah i feel so accomplished and responsible. 

I have a disgustingly long list of things to be done. 
meh. such is the extent of my procrastination.

07S13

this past week has been a BLAST.

and because we love our OGLs so much, we gave each of them a huge vanguard sized card with little messages from each of us in it (aep-ers sneaked off one after another, excusing ourselves from dinner with random excuses) and a cloth-smiley-flower thing. we presented them the gifts and sung an impromptu "we love you OGLS" song followed by group hugs and such, while the rest of the cohort was dancing their asses off in the hall.



this is what we do when we re stuck indoors when theres supposed to be a campfire but its pouring.


take1: us with weird expressions



take2: we were saying "EH-LEEE-PHANT" in slow-mo




take3: us rolling from side to side


take4:  andrew slapping honghu slow-mo

 take5: andrew punching honghu slow-mo


 take6: longhao punching jeffrey slow-mo  (note his psuedo-pained expression. pro!)

 take7: longhao dancing the girl's part with jeffrey as the guy,

guess what, IM HAVING TONS OF FUN!

today was just superhypercrazystone-ish, stoning was saved for the bus rides.


external hunt went well. I bet we were the slackest class around- strolling leisurely through pasir ris park enjoying the breeze, fooling around at the playground upon completion of one of our game station pit stops, getting lost but not really caring, cracking up at random people, bullying poor little andrew, etc etc

OG outing after dismissal, we headed to al-ameen (opp beauty world) for indian cuisine. mutton murtabak!
we were playing rounds and rounds of animalmania and kept increasing the tempo until we were all super stressed. it was hilarious! yaoliang loss every round and had to gulp down 3 shots of milodinosaur-coconut-watermelon-honeydew drink. basically, a mix of everything we had. still, it sounds better than what he was drinking: bandung dinosaur. hur.
did loads of crappy mindgames with yueh hsin and fishball after food. "mehmehmehmehmehmehmeh"

bottom line, i love my civics class! we re kinda enthu, doing waves and our cheers and everything, i hope no one leaves after JAE =/


fifteen oei!  OEI
fifteen oei! OEI
fifteen oei!  WHAT THE?!?

NJ OEI!

i enjoyed myself tremendously today, even through the hot sun, nagging headache, and my incapability to comprehend hand-foot coordinated dance steps.


we started off the day with clan intro performances. HIGHLY entertaining, and the video was hilarious. we broke off into our new OGs, according to the civics classes. im in an odd combi class, no surprise there, since my choice of subject is pretty abnormal.
pfft, normal is overrated. go 07S13!


had mass dance practice in, of all places, the parade square, directly under the scorching sun. it was fun, nonetheless, although i have already completely forgotten 3/4 of the steps already, not counting that im totally lost throughout half of the moves in the first place. grace and i kept cracking up because we were both moving in the wrong directions/ standing still/ turning wrongly etc etc

clan bonding session after that, and we played games, learnt the aerius house song (which is a hell lot simpler to grasp than the school song) and did the rhythmic clapping thing along with it. house games were pretty hilarious as well. they are funny people.
i am so lazy to elaborate

anyhow, currently burnt red and having a terrible t-shirt tan, im contented with my new civics class and the whole NJ thing.
hey, im adapting! hur.

sat met up with the nic and prem, crashed prem's house.
friendster (attack of the she-men!) , hard gay/ flight of the conchords, kayabun, subway niche, mushroom pork balls and seafood tofu, coffee jelly (minus the sugar because we forgot.), playground, windows movie maker

I LOVE YOU GUYS <33

today was the best day among our pre-orientation week orientation, firstly probably because it was the end of long boring talks in the hall, and the beginning of our week-long orientation activities. 
the OGLs tried to teach us NJ cheers and motivate us to cheer along loudly to arouse some NJ spirit but to not much avail, since they chose the wrong times (short breaks between sleep-inducing talks). seeing them so enthusiastic and passionate about cheering for their school struck a cord though: its just like how we were in IJ. It made me think that after a year in this school (hopefully), i might be able to cheer as loudly and with such gusto, like i would have for IJ. 
its so useless to wallow in a past, when youre stuck in the present.
i miss IJ hellalot, and i know that i always will. I'm truly thankful for that opportunity to have enrolled there for a decade, hence taking the IJ spirit along with me as i move forward into the NJ community. 

enough prattling, ive got a busy week ahead of me. 
tmr- OG outing!
sun- studybuddy thingo :D
mon- orientation till 4
tues- orientation till 4
wed-  ODYSSEY external hunt till 5
thurs- orientation till 5
fri- war games, dance party cum campfire cum bbq till 10

frankly, even though its going to be bloody tiring, im kind of looking forward to it. after 3 days of dry talks and introductory lessons, i think we deserve a little week of fun.

so i was just watching the google video link to NJ mass dance val kindly put up on her LJ. 
i swear, their sock tans draw all the attention away from their dance moves. i was sniggering quietly to myself throughout the video, terrible, i know. i should try not to laugh at others to myself all that often. 

NJ day one can only be described by one word: TIRING
gathered in the hall at 730, before that meeting up with isabel and then scooted over to sit with val, shu and delle at the canteen
OG25! i suppose i could have winded up with more boring, taciturn OGLs  but julian, jo, jolene and charmaine seem like a nice bunch of friendly people. (HA val i remember their names.) i somehow managed to get acquainted with a few others in my OG. 
overall, its a rather interesting mix of people. 

NJ was dominated by RV white and speckles of CHIJ blue, more so than previous years i should reckon, since a record high of more than 15 ijtpians were posted here this PAE. its nice to see a few friendly faces among all that distance and unfamiliarity. 

I sat in for a few introductory lessons- econs, lit, KI
They were more informative than anything, although i did enjoy the sarcasm and funny antics of the lit teacher, which actually sparked off a keen interest in taking lit in me, until i heard that he was going to resign soon -.- (that, and ive got too many subjects for my h1-h2 combo) 
econs was rather dry, i was falling asleep and my mind was wondering elsewhere most of the time. 


It could have been worse for a first day at a new school.
NJ is great, but its no IJ.

meh. IJ should establish a junior college.

wed

travelled to bras besar art friend with moooom in the late morning. the moment i stepped in, i was gretted with a whiff of turpentine and the smell of brand new art materials. i made a beeline for the COPICS. they restocked! so there were dozens of pretty new shades available. i spent a good half hour trying out the shades but didnt purchase any in the end, although i did take note of the colours i wanted, and since im holding on to the art friend privilege card i could just pop by any branch to get them. 
anyhow, saved up my cash for basheer. spent a happy hour browsing through the graphic design and fashion illustration books. i never get tired of that place. met my dad at the bookstore and he very kindly paid for this month's issue of territory :D 

headed down to taka afterward, met nic and danny at mos. uni was around taka as well, so she popped by for salutations.
we headed up to kino next, since i was also holding on to the kino privilege card, which means 20% off storewide.i finally got saikano vol4 and emily the strange #7. was sorely tempted to get one of those rather expensive graphic design books but theyre so expensive; definitely worth the splurge, but it still burns a large hole in your wallet. ouch. 
we left kino happy, with bags in hand. 

headed out to the starbucks adjacent to paragon after that, to grab a quick coffee. we initially squeezed four chairs around a puny round table at the pillar, but shifted to the couch seats after this moby-lookalike finally left (he took the entire 6-seater area to himself)
stayed around till it was time to leave and meet prem. 
left with nic, and met her outside breadtalk. took a bus to my place.

we were rather lazy to go all the way to adam road for dinner (sambal seabass, yum) even though theres a straight bus, so we ordered in KFC and watched death note while munching. 
i havent had KFC in a long time, and whilst attacking my second piece i recalled my brief boycotting of KFC chicken because of the video where they exposed the evil means KFC farms used to slaughter the chickens.
putting that aside, i thoroughly enjoyed eating the chicken.

danny came by after the church meeting, and we migrated to my room for more entertainment in the form of daidi, gin rummy and cluedo. we wanted to do mahjong, but were too lazy to drag our asses downstairs to set up the table. theres always next time, anyway. 
gaming till bout 130am, and then we decided to crash the couch and watch moulin rouge. halfway through the first disk, we were all falling asleep (NOT because it was boring or anything, moulin rouge is a fantastic movie) hence decided to go back up to bed. however, once we got all comfortable and ready to sleep we werent sleepy anymore. 
contemplated going back down to continue with the show, but we ended up playing "have you ever", minus the alcohol, using a black permanent marker instead. a very mild and less risque version. ahaha

went to sleep after that, at approx 3am. we broke the chalet record.



thurs

i woke up early,much to my chagrin ,despite sleeping at such a late hour.nic got up soon after, and then we shocked prem up by telling her it was already 10+ and that macs breakfast would be over if she didnt get up (it was actually only 8).
headed to coffee bean for breakfast (cafe cartel wasnt open yet!), and i split a break-0-day and garlic bagel with nic (what would i do without garlic bagels and cream cheese.)

stuffed and happy, we took the mrt and bus to YMCA serviced apartments. met sheeni there and roped her in for singstar on PS2.
its pure FUN. i swear the blue mic was jinxed at the beginning, but blues emerged champions anyway. hoho. i would go into details, but im lazy and nothing could accurately describe the experience. one things for sure though: im never listening to TAKE ME OUT for as long as i can help it. hurrr. 

it was raining when nic's mom dropped us off at wheelock. it was fun annoying cactus. heh heh. he fully deserved it, if you ask me. making you brave the damn rain.

i felt like such a slug today.
the minute i woke up and washed up, i headed downstairs and plopped myself down, talking up the entire length of the sofa and watched some morning news on the teevee.
i felt so lazy and my hair was all chunky, hence my entire morning was spent on the couch lapping up smallville season 3 (my bro bought the dvds in melbourne), although half the time i was just stoning.
anyhow, thomson plaza for lunch with my family, and went supermarket shopping. 
loaded the basket with junk and philidelphia cheese spread (spelling unkwnown). i ve been addicted to that stuff since yesterday at coffee bean.

church at one, plopped myself on the table top and snoozed before the rest of the people came and we did the dnd decor.
drew out a few different masks and painted them, along with audrey claire hannah fran keith and anthony. the guy's mask was hilarious. it looked like a darth vader/ petrified monkey hybrid, and they slopped black paint in the middle of nowhere.oh well. all in good fun. 
i drank a double dose of yakult today, although so did most of the others. blame the new yakult vending machine in church. 

aunty liz bought us chocolate 'n spice bakery muffins! split mine with audrey, since im not too fond of chocolate muffins, i was just being greedy.
decor isnt done, people are coming over again some time to finish it all up. thus, joel and andrew very kindly delivered the syrofoam boards/paints etc over just now, shifted from 02-01.

tomorrow! :D

today was good fun.
we had our long awaited studybuddy outing at east coast park, cycling our asses off from 11 till 5. started off by meeting them at j8 for breakfast, then taking a long 55 bus ride to VJ and then walking to eastcoast. rented our bikes and cycled out.

(i am rather lazy to type out the entire day in prose format soi ll go along with bullet ponts.)

-cycled from bike rental shop to bedok jetty
-cycled till end of jetty for a short break, spied blackened banana peel/ dead starfish lookalike floating around
-planned on making noise to scare the fish away but sticked to simply cycling along as silent observers; we are nice people (:
-cycled out till we reached a (rather) dead end and turned back
-breezed pass other cyclists, happily ringing the bicycle bells at those blasted pedestrians annoyingly taking up the entire length of the cyclist/rollerblader track
-stop along a more deserted part of the shore, and walk into the sea to cool down.
-feel like tanning, and debate on stripping off top but presence of three workers looking at us over the grass deters us from doing so
-move away from three workers to another spot on the beach, but still in view of the workers
-cycle away, sticky with seawater and sandinfeet, to the nearest shower area and wash off a tad
-cycle in opposite direction
-reached eastcoast hawker centre, reluctantly left bicycles outside the centre because of the no-bicycle signs
-had coconuts and satay. happy.
-see other group of cyclists blatantly wheeling their own bicycles into the centre. feel rather dumb and prig-ish
-cycle on, all the way to the other end, pass the bike rentals and macs
-found a nice airy spot, a bench shaded by the casurina (sp???) trees
-we lie down and gossip/ramble/rot
-nic decides to be masseuse of the day and gives each of us a back massage.  
-muscles relaxed and untensed, we feel ready to hit coffee bean.
-cycle to coffee bean, park bikes at scruffy murphy's "for patrons only" bike lots. heck, the place isnt even open
-enter coffee bean. revel in the shade and air con
-order drinks and munchies. garlic bagel <333
-cycle off after tummies are filled, to the far end of east coast
-stop at prem's "emo spot" to soak in the atmosphere.
-decide to return bikes before rain pours down
-walk to the bus stop and take 55 back to j8.it was an interesting bus ride. hmmm.
-home. 



my back is red. it has the spag tan and sportsbra tan so i might as well have been wearing a tee and not tan at all -.-

had FUN. :) I  cant wait till wed!

and missing melbourne. well, actually i was home the night before last, but anyhow

the weather there was fantastic! its like perpetual air-conditioning. and the shopping was awesome.i spent so much O__O like the whole lot of allowance my dad gave plus some. 
oh oh and how could i forget: the BEEF. 

anyhow, we all thoroughly enjoyed the trip and were so reluctant to leave. my parents have decided that they want to send me there or apply for a scholarship for me there to study so that they have a valid excuse to fly there all the time. hur. 


yesterday was fun! met my parents for lunch at j8.
 it was great catching up with nirasha prems and uni in town after that. we catched trust the man at cine. it was rather hilarious and eyecandy-filled, but there were a couple of UHHHHH parts-i guess thats why they rated it nc16.the french guy was hilarious.(yous stayss away from hersss") tobey is an ass. 
shopping for ms ratulangi's wedding gift after that. we settled on a beautiful necklace from chomel, after scouting around for something which looked ms ratulangi-ish. starbucks after that, toffee nut latte <333

*&#(&#^*&$$ technically, i havent started packing. all my stuff is just one big pile. talk about major procrastination -.- theres no goong to fill in my 7-8pm slot anymore. it feels so empty. bfffft. i was staring at my chem tys just now, rotting on the side table. i was overwhelmed by a sudden urge to open it and tackle the questions. of course i didnt in the end; who in the right state of mind would. hur. all this post-o's freedom is making me soft in the head. watched step up before RCIY. its GOOOOODDDDD. crappy, cliche plot but hey, CHANNING TATUM= HOTTIE. so no one really paid much attention to the blasted plot anyway. the dance moves were real smooth, makes you want to jump up in your seat and dance along. His head looked too small for his body in the first act though (rather disturbing), i think it was the baggy clothes. anyhow,he looks GREAT while dancing.all that uber sexiness exuded onto the screen,lapped up by the female audience. makes people happy.-GRINS. back off, val.

19th

chalet day! 
spent most of the morning packing my overnight bag and making a huge tub of potato salad to take along. Left for aranda at around 2, with joel making the backseat a tad more squashy than the norm.it was a long ride, but i had the historian to keep me company and block out his and my bro's annoying remarks. 

reached aranda country club, and checked out the unit we rented. it had a  spacious hall, with nice parquet, two rooms and a balcony just after the back door leading to the yard where the bbq pits were. first thing we did was set the food down in the kitchenette, dump our bags and set up the game cube console we dragged along and played sonic :D omg, i got so so so bad at the blasted game. even joel the noob got further in the game, when i died like 2 minutes into playing. hur hur. i blamed it on the headache.

danny came soon after, and helped us start up the fire, which was being stubborn and refused to heat up the charcoal. the neighbouring pit wasnt doing all that much better, though. prems and evelyn arrived next, and then came over to help start bbqing, since we were all getting just a little hungry. shenn's little friends came and then the whole lot of them went elsewhere to play soccer -.- 
shaun arrived, and then nasha, and alex. introductions all around. 
kristen, jamie,and the other shaun came soon after, met them on the pathway while making my way to the carpark and on the phone with uni giving her directions. 
the food was good, bbqed by joel, eve and danny (thanks <333)
while i hopped around trying to be a good host, introducing my schoolmates to church friends and parents, and trying to stuff everyone with food.
prem was hilarious.

me (to oliver, my bro's classmate): we're done here, you guys can take over the bbq.
oliver: yeah, whatever (which is probably what he says all the time in place of "yes" or "okay". must be a caucasian thing.)
prem: (frowning)so rude!
oliver: (looking perturbed, and kinda scared) im sorry, sorry. i mean, yes ohkay/

his expression was priceless. and every subsequent time he answered with "yeah, whatever" he quickly continued with " i mean, ohkay."

as usual, uni and prem were lusting over "jason scott". pffttt. its so embarrassing. he's my brother! its so so wrong. ahahaha.and eve was going around with tong-in-hand and kept giving them more food. 

my friends seem to like terrorizing poor little sec one kids. hurrr 

michael and adrian came at night, just as the rain was coming down and everyone shifted inside. 
school friends went to our designated room while i played mahjong with rciy-ians. damn michael won every single game. bish. and the posture and angle at which he sat made him look like some seasoned gambler. ahahaha. 

retired from the mahjong table after a few games to watch she's the man in the room, on my mom's laptop. it was rather cold so nasha prems evelyn uni and danny all snuggled under the two quilts. so comfy. 

anyhow, people started leaving and then there were five. (not inclusive of my bro and his 5 friends, or my parents)we watched some other movie, about hiphoppers and dancing but it was rather dry in my opinion. took a warm, deserved shower and then we all went to bed.
prem kept making noise since we were all snuggled and ready to sleep when my brother and his croonies were making noise and were very much awake. ah, the vivacity of youth. they have such energy. we felt so OLD and UNCOOL falling asleep that early (1am) so we got up and gossiped for a bit. soon we were all lying down again under the covers with the lamps off. 
my brother and his friends were up the entire night. thats just mad.
in the wee hours of the morning i heard the door to our room opening and some boys talking (they camped out in the huge hall). even now i have no idea what they were planning to do since before they could enter or whatever, uni stirred in her position and they got all alarmed.(i found out soon after that she did it on purpose) their reaction was so amusing "oh no. i think one of them is awake""EH. SHIT which one." "oh no no shhhhhhhhhhhh"
HAHA. and i decided that if they stepped in i would just sit up with my hair and bangs all covering my face.too bad they chickened out after that and left the door open, continuing thair gaming outside.
uni and i awoke, went to the kitchen through the interconnected bathroom. she left soon after, to take the long train home. 


20th

we all woke up rather reluctantly.had to drag danny up.
the four of us played daidi for a bit, then decided to head out exploring downtown east for a good breakfast spot. went for mcafe in the end. the muffin was great, but the hot coffee was terribly bland and had no kick. although michael buble crooning  in the background was nice.  
wove through the shops and stalls and then decided that we were lazy and unadventurous so why not just head back to the chalet and watch more movies?
watched howl's moving castle. it was three votes against one. 
val came soon after, at about 230pm and joined us halfway through the plot.
prem fell asleep. i took pictures. meh heh.
we watched shrek2 next! and rain was coming down hard, so val was stuck with us a while longer than expected. my bro's friends left so we had all the unopened ruffles and doritos plus the dark chocolate bars prem and nasha brought. junk haven. 

danny and i taught nasha and prems how to play mahjong after that.i had to write the sequence of chinese numerals on serviettes with my mom's microns so they could play. it was fun, played a consecutive 2-3 hours, just the four of us. we conclude that mahjong is terribly addictive. 
it was 7pm, GOONG TIME. i thank heavens for the TV. we shifted the mahjong table across the hall till it was just right in front of the tv and watched while playing. hur hur. 
nasha's mom came soon after so prem and her had to leave. 
my parents went out to buy some dinner back so danny and i watched goong. (ohkay maybe i was watching while she was staring, wondering how i could endure and hour of lame-romance-plot korean drama) oh well, what can i say. KJH is such a show stealer :DDDD

packed up, (my dad and bro were lazy to bunk in another night, so decided to go home too.)and sent danny home first before heading home ourselves. i had a good sleep. 


21st

i had to wake up early. daddy sent me to school for PAE. 
mrs how-yip gave us prom-briefing (the norm, no low-backed, plunging neckline, inviting of other people, strict entrance criteria yadda yadda)
and then the PAE briefing. collected our cca records, prelim result slips and the school official leaving certificate.
i feel sad. im not a secondary school student anymore.
more than anything, i feel OLD. -.-
anyway, met uni who conveniently arrived after the entire thing was over and mr teh was leaving.
we headed for town after that. speant a good half-hour and starbucks first (it was so nicely quiet and empty) since the heeren shops werent even open. 
headed for shops to look for evening gowns/ formals skirts. we entered chaos, where while looking at the whole array of black stuff available, the salesgirl came up and asked us to stay just for a bit more because there was this male customer (who was concurrently trying something on in the fitting room) who was a perv and just touched her thigh and the place was so quiet. so, we stayed, under the pretense of looking intently at the clubbing-clothes on sale. we chatted with the lady, who was really really nice and she told us about all the pervs hanging around heeren. it was really... enlightening. ahaha. i wonder how such people can actually exist to do such shameful acts. the dude left, reserving a pair of pants and telling her that he would come collect it later, so hung around a while more, talked to the salesperson and then left. made a round about the level and then headed towards the escalators.
while walking past chaos again, we spied the same perv guy in the shop. i suspect he came to "claim" his reserved pair of pants, just after we left. so uni and i loitered on the outside of the store, until we saw him re-entering the fitting room and hence we wnet back into the store. she was so glad to see us, it was a good thing we checked while walking past. the guy came out of the fitting and took an awfully long time to finally put on his shoes and purchase the pants. all the while, i sat directly opposite them, in full view of the counter while uni tried on some stuff. i daresay he didnt do anything else while we were both hanging around. 
he left and then we stayed to talk with the saleslady awhile more. we are friendly people. hur hur. 
spent the entire day searching for s prom outfit, but ended up with a nice new belt and black leggings, both of which i have been pining to get since a long time ago and fortunately found today. 
i am happy :D 
rushed home just in time to catch the final episode of GOONG.T-T nooooooooo yul turned himself in in place of his mother. so filial<33 


val! the black leggings are sold at zara for $16.90, mango is a ripoff at $30.

ITS OVERRRRRRRRR.

I believe it hasnt really sunk in yet. somehow, i keep thinking that i have another paper to cram for.
hur hur.

i can finally, finally do everything ive been wanting to do since o's started. there s so much anime in my comp, because my external hard disk is full. 3 weeks worth of anime. bliss. :D

SHOPPING TMR, WITH NASHA AND PREMS <3333 
 -BEAMS

ONE MORE DAY, JUST ONE MORE DAY.

ive been spinning the same track on repeat. hmm. i think its the 15th time im listening to it.

bad, bad timing.
